image.altText: A large crowd of people queue at Sydney airport

props.synopsis: Computer security company CrowdStrike is linked to a major IT outage affecting banks, airports, supermarkets and businesses across Australia and the world. Follow live.

title.children: Cyber security company CrowdStrike linked to global IT outage

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: A national emergency meeting is underway
NBN apparently unaffected by global outage
Major cyber security firm says CrowdStrike has deployed a fix

image.altText: A laptop computer sits open on a bed in a dark room showing an email account on screen.

props.synopsis: Here's what we know about the IT outage affecting users around Australia and the world.

title.children: Australians have been hit by a worldwide tech outage. Here's what we know

image.altText: The Crowdstrike logo, red and white with an eagle swooping down

props.synopsis: The global outage impacts a raft of Australian companies and government agencies. Here's the latest on the company reportedly responsible.

title.children: What is CrowdStrike? Here's what we know so far

image.altText: A pile of tablets with embossed numbers and letters sits on a dark surface

props.synopsis: SA Health is warning of the life-threatening dangers of a synthetic opioid after an Adelaide man almost died in hospital when he consumed a single street-purchased oxycodone pill last week.

title.children: 'This drug can kill you in a tablet': Warnings over potentially deadly synthetic opioid

image.altText: Scientists open an octopus.

props.synopsis: School-age, university students and keen members of the public have gathered to observe a rare public dissection of a 140kg octopus squid found off South Australia's Eyre Peninsula.

title.children: 'Exceptionally rare' octopus squid dissected by researchers at SA university

image.altText: Julie Critchley and her husband next to a Mockingbird sign

props.synopsis: A foster care program that links up parents to create an extended family-like environment has helped improve carer retention and created better placement stability for children — with the program's facilitator now looking to further expand the program across the country.

title.children: 'Blend like cousins': Mockingbird foster program mimics extended family

image.altText: Joe Biden, wearing a cap, slacks and a jumper, waves as he descends the stairs of an airplane

props.synopsis: The US president, currently isolating with COVID-19, is said to be reflecting on whether to drop out as the presumptive Democratic candidate in the November election.

title.children: Biden reportedly 'soul-searching' on whether to stay in 2024 presidential race

image.altText: A man in a suit surrounded by lights

props.synopsis: In a 92-minute speech, Donald Trump used Joe Biden's name only once, and asked a roaring crowd of party faithful to send him back to the White House. Meanwhile, the president endured another day of leaks and anonymous sources citing pressure for him to drop out of the race.

title.children: 'Blood everywhere': Trump describes shooting and Melania returns, as Republican Convention reaches crescendo

image.altText: a man wearing glasses standing outdoors in front of a media pack

props.synopsis: The former NSW Liberal leader, who was the state's premier from October 2021 to March 2023, announces his resignation from politics and will head up BHP's office in Washignton DC.

title.children: Perrottet lands plum job in US after announcing end of his political career

image.altText: A female crayfish stretches its claws and had  eggs under its tail like little red berries

props.synopsis: The species has been mostly absent from the South Australian stretch of the river for around 40 years. Now, the population is getting another boost.

title.children: Once extinct Murray crayfish on track to 'thrive again' in SA's River Murray

image.altText: A closeup shot of the prime minister looking sombre, wearing glasses and frowning

props.synopsis: No doubt the administrators will clean out the CFMEU. But you'd be an optimist to feel confident that one collection of bad applies won't eventually be replaced by another.

title.children: The bad apples at the CFMEU are on the way out. The next crop deserves close attention

image.altText: Two police officers are in uniform with their faces blurred out. In the background are houses and empty land

props.synopsis: Police are ordered to reinvestigate allegations they used unreasonable force against kids during a shopping centre scuffle.

title.children: Watch this police officer's response when he's asked, 'How many Black kids are you going to assault?'

image.altText: A large outside view of a compound

props.synopsis: The number of refugees being held on Nauru has increased sixfold in six months, even though the centre was empty at one stage last year.

title.children: Offshore detention numbers increase sixfold as advocates slam policy as 'financial and moral vacuum'

image.altText: Two small snowmen made from sleet on a car park ground in Guyra New Suoth Wales

props.synopsis: Parts of eastern Australia are set for another round of fierce wintry weather, with warnings of damaging winds for several states, and blizzards in Australia's alpine regions from Friday.

title.children: Damaging winds, snow and rain forecast for eastern Australia

image.altText: Two emergency service officers in an area cordoned off by red tape

props.synopsis: The Israeli army reviews a blast in central Tel Aviv which made it through the IDF's aerial defences, with Yemen's Houthi militants claiming responsibility for a "military operation" in the city.

title.children: Yemen's Houthis claim military operation in Tel Aviv as IDF investigates explosion

image.altText: Graves at Fromelles, France following the infamous battle of July 1916

props.synopsis: The remains of 70 Australian WWI soldiers found in a mass grave at Fromelles are still to be identified. On the anniversary of the bloody battle they died in, a volunteer organisation is asking for help and DNA to give them back their names.

title.children: DNA detective work could end the mystery of 70 unknown diggers killed in Fromelles horror

image.altText: A woman with journalists standing behind.

props.synopsis: The Wall Street Journal has been slammed over its firing of reporter Selina Cheng, who had been elected head of Hong Kong's largest media union.

title.children: Chinese media applauds Wall Street Journal's sacking of Hong Kong journalist

image.altText: AFL assistant coach Dean Cox smiles at training.

props.synopsis: West Coast club legend Dean Cox rules himself out of the running for the Eagles vacant coaching role, opting instead to stay in Sydney with the Swans.

title.children: Dean Cox resists lure of West Coast coaching job, opts to stay in Sydney

image.altText: A pencil and watercolour sketch of a historic two-storey building with shops on the street level

props.synopsis: Comic artist Jo Waite has spent her adult life renting and squatting in Melbourne's inner suburbs, watching gentrification unfold in real time. Now, she is drawing her old homes one by one — but the beauty of the grand homes hides the reality of life inside them for tenants in decades past.

title.children: 'The call of a million dollars': How gentrification changed the neighbourhoods that were once affordable to artists

image.altText: Two women walking outside towards the camera

props.synopsis: A childcare worker accused of assaulting preschoolers at an early learning centre in Perth's north is found guilty of just five of the 32 charges she was facing.

title.children: Perth childcare worker found guilty of scratching children in her care, but acquitted of most charges

image.altText: two divers in a shallow creek

props.synopsis: Markiah Major's family and friends haven't heard from him since last August. A coroner has concluded he was likely paranoid and became disoriented when he walked into a secluded tropical forest on the evening he disappeared.

title.children: Missing teenager most likely died in 'dense, impenetrable' rainforest, says coroner

image.altText: A man in a safety vest and hard hat smiles from a platform above a power station

props.synopsis: A feasibility study with AGL to explore green hydrogen possibilities at the now-closed Liddell coal-fired power station looks to be on the backburner. But Fortescue chairman Andrew Forrest insist he's not walking away from hydrogen.

title.children: Fortescue-backed green hydrogen partnership on hold after job cuts at metals giant

image.altText: Hacking

props.synopsis: eScripts provider MediSecure has revealed 12.9 million Australians had personal data stolen in a cyber breach earlier this year, making it one of the largest data hacks in Australian history.

title.children: MediSecure 'not in a financial position' to identify 12.9m Australians who had data stolen

image.altText: A police officer stands next to a NT Police car.

props.synopsis: Three people have died at the scene of a two-car collision on the Stuart Highway, about 160 kilometres south of Darwin.

title.children: Three people killed in highway crash in remote Northern Territory

image.altText: A bald man, wearing a suit and smiling.

props.synopsis: Former Australian Olympic administrator Kevan Gosper — who won a silver medal as an athlete at the 1956 Melbourne Games — has died following a short illness.

title.children: Australian Olympic powerbroker Kevan Gosper dies, aged 90

image.altText: Dave holding a brush, standing in front of the large cowboy he painted.

props.synopsis: The craft of sign painting has taken a hit in the digital era but painters like Dave Johnson say computers cannot replicate the charm of hand-produced pieces.

title.children: Old-school sign painter battles against computers to keep lost art alive

image.altText: A close up shows a red cap with white text in all caps saying TRUMP FOREVER

props.synopsis: Trump's speech, and the entire atmosphere of the Republican National Convention, are reminders of America's new direction. They're also a chance to recall his record in office and judge it against what he's offering now.

title.children: Trump is not a blip, he's the correction. The Republican Party on show this week is the new normal

image.altText: Donald Trump raises a fist while speaking on stage.

props.synopsis: Donald Trump has taken the stage at the Republican National Convention for his first public speech since an attempt on his life. Meanwhile, US media is reporting "reality is setting in" for a "soul-searching" US President Joe Biden as pressure mounts to quit the presidential race.

title.children: 'I'm not supposed to be here': Trump reflects on shooting as he accepts Republican nomination

image.altText: A close up of Greg Lynn standing in front of a body of water near some rocks.

props.synopsis: Former Jetstar pilot Greg Lynn will appeal his murder conviction, his lawyer says, after he was found guilty of killing retiree Carol Clay in Victoria's High Country.

title.children: Media reports about Greg Lynn have 'poisoned the well of justice', lawyer tells court

image.altText: Georgia Weir, in black hoodie with long brown hair tied up, smiles. Body of water and green hills are behind her.

props.synopsis: For Kuku Yalanji woman Georgia Weir, running became a way to manage the impacts of trauma that she'd battled for much of her life. Now she's keen to share its incredible impact with as many people as she can.

title.children: This young mum was in crisis. She says one routine 'completely changed the trajectory of my life'

image.altText: Jess Fox pictured on a kayak

props.synopsis: Jess Fox won the hearts of a nation three years ago with her gold medal in Tokyo. Now the Australian star is aiming for much more than a solitary gold medal in Paris.

title.children: The 'perfect result' that would allow Jess Fox to join exclusive Australian Olympic club

image.altText: Mary Fowler celebrates with Caitlin Foord

props.synopsis: With Sam Kerr sidelined, Mary Fowler will take centre stage for the Matildas during the team's upcoming Olympic campaign.

title.children: Mary Fowler's spotlight admission ahead of starring role for Matildas at Paris Olympics

image.altText: A teenage boy sits on a step drinking Fanta next to a young girl who looks away from him to the right.

props.synopsis: A delightful mockumentary that underscores the universality of childhood grandiosity and imagination, plus seven feature films by Black filmmakers to catch at the very first Africa Film Fest Australia this weekend.

title.children: 'Everyday I drink two Fantas': Black boyhood is in the spotlight at this inaugural African film festival
